title: Electron Backscatter Diffraction Analysis of Microstructure in Spray Formed AA7050 Aluminium Alloy
content: The aluminum alloy AA7050 contains Al-Zn-Mg-Cu in its composition, providing low density, high strength, ductility, toughness, fatigue resistance, and stress corrosion cracking resistance, making it a preferred choice in various industrial and aerospace applications [1]. This work presents an analysis of the use of EBSD to investigate the microstructure of the AA7050 alloy, exploring aspects such as phase distribution, grain orientation, presence of defects, and phase interactions. Understanding the microstructure of the AA7050 alloy through EBSD is essential for optimizing its performance and developing new processing strategies to meet the increasing demands for more efficient and resistant materials.
